intro: Tephrosia youngii, commonly known as African senna, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, which is characterized by its leguminous properties and nitrogen-fixing capabilities. The plant produces small, yellow flowers that are clustered in racemes, and its leaves are pinnately compound with an odd number of leaflets. Tephrosia youngii is often found in open woodlands and savannas, thriving in well-drained soils. It is also valued for its medicinal properties and is used in traditional herbal remedies.
